intro: Viscaria alpina f. albiflora, commonly known as the alpine white-flowered mouse-ear. This plant is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae, characterized by its small, hairy leaves and showy, white flowers. It is native to alpine regions of Europe and is adapted to cold, rocky environments. The flowers are typically borne on long, slender stems and bloom in early summer. It is a low-growing plant that often forms dense mats, contributing to soil stabilization in its habitat.
